Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Palette for cosmetics
Description: Very lovely palette for cosmetics in the shape of a truncated oval. Hewn from an opaque quartz, the colour of which varies from light grey to very light brown-grey, it is slightly curved at the edges. This type of artefact was used to grind green (malachite) or black (galena) cosmetics, traces of which are often found on such objects, however this is not the case here.
